text.p: Scotland raced in five tries to one to beat Ireland 38-10 at Murrayfield on Saturday in their Five Nations rugby championship match.

Injury-weakened Ireland, without a win in Edinburgh since 1985, led 7-0 after a converted 22nd minute try by winger Denis Hickey, but the Scots levelled the match at the break through a converted try to centre Alan Tait.
The second half was one-way traffic as Scotland took control with tries to Peter Walton, Doddie Weir, Gregor Townsend and Tony Stanger.
Both countries now have one win. Ireland have competed their fixtures while Scotland meet France in a fortnight's time in Paris.
